ja2:1.2: Resolve _udaṅgaṇa_ as _uda_ (“water”) and _aṅgaṇa_, from a root sense of “going”, from where we find the Sanskrit sense of “passage” (against the commentary, which says _uda_ is a mere particle). In the prose story, the Bodhisatta, lost with his caravan in the desert, hears water rushing underground and urges a young man to dig.
